flixel.ui.FlxSlider

type
class
extends
flixel.group.FlxSpriteGroup
A slider GUI element for float and integer manipulation.

Constructor

new(Object : Dynamic, VarString : String, ?X : Float, ?Y : Float, ?MinValue : Float, ?MaxValue : Float, ?Width : Int, ?Height : Int, ?Thickness : Int, ?Color : Int, ?HandleColor : Int)
parameters
Object Reference to the parent object of the variable
VarString Variable that the slider controls
X x Position
Y y Position
MinValue Mininum value the variable can be changed to
MaxValue Maximum value the variable can be changed to
Width Width of the slider
Height Height of the slider
Thickness Thickness of the slider
Color Color of the slider background and all texts except for valueText showing the current value
HandleColor Color of the slider handle and the valueText showing the current value
Creates a new FlxSlider.

Instance Variables hide inherited show inherited

ID : Int

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
IDs seem like they could be pretty useful, huh? They're not actually used for anything yet though.

acceleration(default,accessor) : flixel.util.FlxPoint

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
How fast the speed of this object is changing (in pixels per second). Useful for smooth movement and gravity.

active(default,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Controls whether update() is automatically called by FlxState/FlxGroup.

alive(default,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Useful state for many game objects - "dead" (!alive) vs alive. kill() and revive() both flip this switch (along with exists, but you can override that).

allowCollisions : Int

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
Bit field of flags (use with UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, etc) indicating collision directions. Use bitwise operators to check the values stored here. Useful for things like one-way platforms (e.g. allowCollisions = UP;). The accessor "solid" just flips this variable between NONE and ANY.

alpha(default,accessor) : Float

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
Set alpha to a number between 0 and 1 to change the opacity of the sprite.

angle(default,accessor) : Float

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
Set the angle of a sprite to rotate it. WARNING: rotating sprites decreases rendering performance for this sprite by a factor of 10x (in Flash target)!

angularAcceleration : Float

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
How fast the spin speed should change (in degrees per second).

angularDrag : Float

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
Like drag but for spinning.

angularVelocity : Float

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
This is how fast you want this sprite to spin (in degrees per second).

animation : flixel.animation.FlxAnimationController

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
Class that handles adding and playing animations on this sprite.

antialiasing : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
Controls whether the object is smoothed when rotated, affects performance.

autoReviveMembers(accessor,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.group.FlxSpriteGroup
Whether revive() also revives all members of this group. False by default.

bakedRotation(default,null) : Float

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
How many frames of "baked" rotation there are (if any).

blend(accessor,accessor) : flash.display.BlendMode

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
Blending modes, just like Photoshop or whatever, e.g. "multiply", "screen", etc.

body : flixel.FlxSprite

The horizontal line in the background.

cachedGraphics(default,accessor) : flixel.util.loaders.CachedGraphics

inherited from flixel.FlxObject

callback : Float -> Void

A function to be called when the slider was used. The current relativePos is passed as an argument.

cameras : Array<FlxCamera>

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
An array of camera objects that this object will use during draw(). This value will initialize itself during the first draw to automatically point at the main camera list out in FlxG unless you already set it. You can also change it afterward too, very flexible!

clickSound : String

Sound that's played whenever the slider is clicked.

collisionType : flixel.system.FlxCollisionType

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic

color(default,accessor) : Int

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
Set color to a number in this format: 0xRRGGBB. color IGNORES ALPHA. To change the opacity use alpha. Tints the whole sprite to be this color (similar to OpenGL vertex colors).

colorTransform(accessor,null) : flash.geom.ColorTransform

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
TODO: Needs docs

debugBoundingBoxColor(default,accessor) : Int

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
Overriding this will force a specific color to be used for debug rect.

decimals : Int

How many decimals the variable can have at max. Default is zero, or "only whole numbers".

dirty : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
Set this flag to true to force the sprite to update during the draw() call. NOTE: Rarely if ever necessary, most sprite operations will flip this flag automatically.

drag(default,accessor) : flixel.util.FlxPoint

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
This isn't drag exactly, more like deceleration that is only applied when acceleration is not affecting the sprite.

elasticity : Float

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
The bounciness of this object. Only affects collisions. Default value is 0, or "not bouncy at all."

exists(default,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
This flag indicates whether this objects has been destroyed or not. Cannot be set, use destroy() and revive().

expectedPos(accessor,null) : Float

The expected position of the handle based on the current variable value.

facing(default,accessor) : Int

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
Set facing using FlxObject.LEFT,RIGHT, UP, and DOWN to take advantage of flipped sprites and/or just track player orientation more easily.

flipped(default,null) : Int

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
If the Sprite is flipped. Shouldn't be changed unless you know what are you doing.

forceComplexRender(default,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
Whether the object should use complex render on flash target (which uses draw() method) or not. WARNING: setting forceComplexRender to true decreases rendering performance for this object by a factor of 10x!

frame(default,accessor) : flixel.system.layer.frames.FlxFrame

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
Link to current FlxFrame from loaded atlas

frameHeight(default,null) : Int

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
The height of the actual graphic or image being displayed (not necessarily the game object/bounding box).

framePixels : flash.display.BitmapData

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
The actual Flash BitmapData object representing the current display state of the sprite.

frameWidth(default,null) : Int

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
The width of the actual graphic or image being displayed (not necessarily the game object/bounding box).

frames(default,null) : Int

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
The total number of frames in this image. WARNING: assumes each row in the sprite sheet is full!

inherited from flixel.FlxObject

inherited from flixel.group.FlxSpriteGroup

The dragable handle - loadGraphic() to change its graphic.

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
Handy for storing health percentage or armor points or whatever.

height(default,accessor) : Float

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
The height of this object's hitbox. For sprites, use offset to control the hitbox position.

hoverAlpha : Float

The alpha value the slider uses when it's hovered over. 1 to turn the effect off.

hoverSound : String

Sound that's played whenever the slider is hovered over.

ignoreDrawDebug : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Setting this to true will prevent the object from appearing when the visual debug mode in the debugger overlay is toggled on.

immovable(default,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
Whether an object will move/alter position after a collision.

last : flixel.util.FlxPoint

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
Important variable for collision processing. By default this value is set automatically during preUpdate().

length(accessor,null) : Int

inherited from flixel.group.FlxSpriteGroup
The number of entries in the members array. For performance and safety you should check this variable instead of members.length unless you really know what you're doing!

mass : Float

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
The virtual mass of the object. Default value is 1. Currently only used with elasticity during collision resolution. Change at your own risk; effects seem crazy unpredictable so far!

maxAngular : Float

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
Use in conjunction with angularAcceleration for fluid spin speed control.

maxLabel : flixel.text.FlxText

The text under the right border - equals maxValue by default.

maxSize(accessor,accessor) : Int

inherited from flixel.group.FlxSpriteGroup
The maximum capacity of this group. Default is 0, meaning no max capacity, and the group can just grow.

maxValue : Float

Maximum value the variable can be changed to.

maxVelocity(default,accessor) : flixel.util.FlxPoint

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
If you are using acceleration, you can use maxVelocity with it to cap the speed automatically (very useful!).

members(accessor,null) : Array<flixel.FlxSprite>

inherited from flixel.group.FlxSpriteGroup
The link to a group's members array

minLabel : flixel.text.FlxText

The text under the left border - equals minValue by default.

minValue : Float

Mininum value the variable can be changed to.

moves(default,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
Set this to false if you want to skip the automatic motion/movement stuff (see updateMotion()). FlxObject and FlxSprite default to true. FlxText, FlxTileblock and FlxTilemap default to false.

nameLabel : flixel.text.FlxText

A text above the slider that displays its name.

offset(default,accessor) : flixel.util.FlxPoint

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
Controls the position of the sprite's hitbox. Likely needs to be adjusted after changing a sprite's width or height.

origin(default,accessor) : flixel.util.FlxPoint

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
WARNING: The origin of the sprite will default to its center. If you change this, the visuals and the collisions will likely be pretty out-of-sync if you do any rotation.

pixels(accessor,accessor) : flash.display.BitmapData

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
Set pixels to any BitmapData object. Automatically adjust graphic size and render helpers.

region(default,null) : flixel.system.layer.Region

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
Rendering variables.

relativePos(accessor,null) : Float

The position of the handle relative to the slider / max value.

scale(default,accessor) : flixel.util.FlxPoint

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
Change the size of your sprite's graphic. NOTE: Scale doesn't currently affect collisions automatically, you will need to adjust the width, height and offset manually. WARNING: scaling sprites decreases rendering performance for this sprite by a factor of 10x!

scrollFactor(default,accessor) : flixel.util.FlxPoint

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
Controls how much this object is affected by camera scrolling. 0 = no movement (e.g. a background layer), 1 = same movement speed as the foreground. Default value: 1, 1.

solid(accessor,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
Whether the object collides or not. For more control over what directions the object will collide from, use collision constants (like LEFT, FLOOR, etc) to set the value of allowCollisions directly.

touching : Int

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
Bit field of flags (use with UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, etc) indicating surface contacts. Use bitwise operators to check the values stored here, or use touching(), justStartedTouching(), etc. You can even use them broadly as boolean values if you're feeling saucy!

useColorTransform(default,null) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
Internal, reflects the need to use _colorTransform object

value : Float

Stores the current value of the variable - updated each frame.

valueLabel : flixel.text.FlxText

A text under the slider that displays the current value.

varString(default,accessor) : String

Stores the variable the slider controls.

velocity(default,accessor) : flixel.util.FlxPoint

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
The basic speed of this object (in pixels per second).

visible(default,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Controls whether draw() is automatically called by FlxState/FlxGroup.

wasTouching : Int

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
Bit field of flags (use with UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, etc) indicating surface contacts from the previous game loop step. Use bitwise operators to check the values stored here, or use touching(), justStartedTouching(), etc. You can even use them broadly as boolean values if you're feeling saucy!

width(default,accessor) : Float

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
The width of this object's hitbox. For sprites, use offset to control the hitbox position.

x(default,accessor) : Float

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
X position of the upper left corner of this object in world space.

y(default,accessor) : Float

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
Y position of the upper left corner of this object in world space.

inherited from flixel.group.FlxSpriteGroup
parameters
Object The sprite or sprite group you want to add to the group.
returns
The same object that was passed in.

inline callAll(FunctionName : String, ?Args : Array<Dynamic>, ?Recurse : Bool) : Void

inherited from flixel.group.FlxSpriteGroup
parameters
FunctionName The string representation of the function you want to call on each object, for example "kill()" or "init()".
Recurse Default value is true, meaning if callAll() encounters a member that is a group, it will call callAll() on that group rather than calling the group's function.
Go through and call the specified function on all members of the group. Currently only works on functions that have no required parameters.

centerOffsets(?AdjustPosition : Bool) : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
parameters
AdjustPosition Adjusts the actual X and Y position just once to match the offset change. Default is false.
Helper function that adjusts the offset automatically to center the bounding box within the graphic.

inline clear() : Void

inherited from flixel.group.FlxSpriteGroup
Remove all instances of FlxSprite from the list. WARNING: does not destroy() or kill() any of these objects!

inherited from flixel.group.FlxSpriteGroup
parameters
NewSprite optional sprite group to copy to
returns
copy of this sprite group
Recursive cloning method: it will create copy of this group which will hold copies of all sprites

inline getFirstAlive() : flixel.FlxSprite

inherited from flixel.group.FlxSpriteGroup
returns
A FlxSprite currently flagged as not dead.
Call this function to retrieve the first object with dead == false in the group. This is handy for checking if everything's wiped out, or choosing a squad leader, etc.

inline getFirstAvailable(?ObjectClass : Class<flixel.FlxSprite>, ?Force : Bool) : flixel.FlxSprite

inherited from flixel.group.FlxSpriteGroup
parameters
ObjectClass An optional parameter that lets you narrow the results to instances of this particular class.
Force Force the object to be an ObjectClass and not a super class of ObjectClass.
returns
A FlxSprite currently flagged as not existing.
Call this function to retrieve the first object with exists == false in the group. This is handy for recycling in general, e.g. respawning enemies.

inherited from flixel.group.FlxSpriteGroup
returns
A FlxSprite currently flagged as dead.
Call this function to retrieve the first object with dead == true in the group. This is handy for checking if everything's wiped out, or choosing a squad leader, etc.

inherited from flixel.group.FlxSpriteGroup
returns
A FlxSprite currently flagged as existing.

getScreenXY(?point : flixel.util.FlxPoint, ?Camera : FlxCamera) : flixel.util.FlxPoint

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
parameters
Camera Specify which game camera you want. If null getScreenXY() will just grab the first global camera.
Point Takes a FlxPoint object and assigns the post-scrolled X and Y values of this object to it.
returns
The Point you passed in, or a new Point if you didn't pass one, containing the screen X and Y position of this object.
Call this function to figure out the on-screen position of the object.

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
parameters
Damage How much health to take away (use a negative number to give a health bonus).
Reduces the "health" variable of this sprite by the amount specified in Damage. Calls kill() if health drops to or below zero.

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
returns
Whether the object is within the Worldbounds or not.

kill() : Void

inherited from flixel.group.FlxSpriteGroup
Calls kill on the group's members and then on the group itself. You can revive this group later via revive() after this.

onScreen(?Camera : flixel.FlxCamera) : Bool

inherited from flixel.group.FlxSpriteGroup
parameters
Camera Specify which game camera you want. If null getScreenXY() will just grab the first global camera.
returns
Whether the object is on screen or not.
Check and see if any sprite in this group is currently on screen.

overlaps(ObjectOrGroup : FlxBasic, ?InScreenSpace : Bool, ?Camera : FlxCamera) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
parameters
ObjectOrGroup The object or group being tested.
InScreenSpace Whether to take scroll factors into account when checking for overlap. Default is false, or "only compare in world space."
Camera Specify which game camera you want. If null getScreenXY() will just grab the first global camera.
returns
Whether or not the two objects overlap.
Checks to see if some FlxObject overlaps this FlxObject or FlxGroup. If the group has a LOT of things in it, it might be faster to use FlxG.overlaps(). WARNING: Currently tilemaps do NOT support screen space overlap checks!

overlapsAt(X : Float, Y : Float, ObjectOrGroup : FlxBasic, ?InScreenSpace : Bool, ?Camera : FlxCamera) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
parameters
X The X position you want to check. Pretends this object (the caller, not the parameter) is located here.
Y The Y position you want to check. Pretends this object (the caller, not the parameter) is located here.
ObjectOrGroup The object or group being tested.
InScreenSpace Whether to take scroll factors into account when checking for overlap. Default is false, or "only compare in world space."
Camera Specify which game camera you want. If null getScreenXY() will just grab the first global camera.
returns
Whether or not the two objects overlap.
Checks to see if this FlxObject were located at the given position, would it overlap the FlxObject or FlxGroup? This is distinct from overlapsPoint(), which just checks that point, rather than taking the object's size into account. WARNING: Currently tilemaps do NOT support screen space overlap checks!

overlapsPoint(point : flixel.util.FlxPoint, ?InScreenSpace : Bool, ?Camera : flixel.FlxCamera) : Bool

inherited from flixel.group.FlxSpriteGroup
parameters
Point The point in world space you want to check.
InScreenSpace Whether to take scroll factors into account when checking for overlap.
Camera Specify which game camera you want. If null getScreenXY() will just grab the first global camera.
returns
Whether or not the point overlaps this group.
Checks to see if a point in 2D world space overlaps any FlxSprite object from this group.

pixelsOverlapPoint(point : flixel.util.FlxPoint, ?Mask : Int, ?Camera : flixel.FlxCamera) : Bool

inherited from flixel.group.FlxSpriteGroup
parameters
Point The point in world space you want to check.
Mask Used in the pixel hit test to determine what counts as solid.
Camera Specify which game camera you want. If null getScreenXY() will just grab the first global camera.
returns
Whether or not the point overlaps this object.
Checks to see if a point in 2D world space overlaps any of FlxSprite object's current displayed pixels. This check is ALWAYS made in screen space, and always takes scroll factors into account.

inline recycle(?ObjectClass : Class<flixel.FlxSprite>, ?ContructorArgs : Array<Dynamic>, ?Force : Bool) : flixel.FlxSprite

inherited from flixel.group.FlxSpriteGroup
parameters
ObjectClass The class type you want to recycle (e.g. FlxSprite, EvilRobot, etc). Do NOT "new" the class in the parameter!
ContructorArgs An array of arguments passed into a newly object if there aren't any dead members to recycle.
Force Force the object to be an ObjectClass and not a super class of ObjectClass.
returns
A reference to the object that was created. Don't forget to cast it back to the Class you want (e.g. myObject = myGroup.recycle(myObjectClass) as myObjectClass;).
Recycling is designed to help you reuse game objects without always re-allocating or "newing" them.

remove(Object : flixel.FlxSprite, ?Splice : Bool) : flixel.FlxSprite

inherited from flixel.group.FlxSpriteGroup
parameters
Object The FlxSprite you want to remove.
Splice Whether the object should be cut from the array entirely or not.
returns
The removed object.
Removes specified sprite from the group.

inherited from flixel.group.FlxSpriteGroup
parameters
Color Color to replace
NewColor New color
FetchPositions Whether we need to store positions of pixels which colors were replaced
returns
Array replaced pixels positions
Replaces all pixels with specified Color with NewColor pixels. This operation is applied to every nested sprite from this group

Obj1 The first object being sorted.
Obj2 The second object being sorted.
returns
An integer value: -1 (Obj1 before Obj2), 0 (same), or 1 (Obj1 after Obj2).
Helper function for the sort process.

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite

inherited from flixel.group.FlxSpriteGroup

inline setAll(VariableName : String, Value : Dynamic, ?Recurse : Bool) : Void

inherited from flixel.group.FlxSpriteGroup
parameters
VariableName The string representation of the variable name you want to modify, for example "visible" or "scrollFactor".
Value The value you want to assign to that variable.
Recurse Default value is true, meaning if setAll() encounters a member that is a group, it will call setAll() on that group rather than modifying its variable.
Go through and set the specified variable to the specified value on all members of the group.

setPosition(?X : Float, ?Y : Float) : Void

inherited from flixel.group.FlxSpriteGroup
parameters
X The new x position
Y The new y position
Helper function to set the coordinates of this object. Handy since it only requires one line of code.

inline setSize(Width : Float, Height : Float) : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
parameters
Width The new sprite width.
Height The new sprite height.
Shortcut for setting both width and Height.

setTexts(Name : String, ?Value : Bool, ?Min : String, ?Max : String, ?Size : Int) : Void

parameters
Name Text of nameLabel - null to hide
Value Whether to show the valueText or not
Min Text of minLabel - null to hide
Max Text of maxLabel - null to hide
Size Size to use for the texts
Handy function for changing the textfields.

inline sort(?Index : String, ?Order : Int) : Void

inherited from flixel.group.FlxSpriteGroup
parameters
Index The String name of the member variable you want to sort on. Default value is "y".
Order A FlxGroup constant that defines the sort order. Possible values are ASCENDING and DESCENDING. Default value is ASCENDING.
Call this function to sort the group according to a particular value and order. For example, to sort game objects for Zelda-style overlaps you might call myGroup.sort("y",ASCENDING) at the bottom of your FlxState.update() override. To sort all existing objects after a big explosion or bomb attack, you might call myGroup.sort("exists",DESCENDING).

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
